In high-grade glial tumors. Found in all anaplastic ependymomas but in only 33% of ependymomas and 16% of myxopapillary ependymomas. In 63% of glioblastomas but not in other astrocytic tumors. No gamma-synuclein in medulloblastomas.
SNCG is required for efficient ER-alpha signaling in brest cancer.

Low expression level of gamma-synuclein in human esophageal squamous cell carcinoma(ESCC) and biological effects of gamma-synuclein over-expression on ESCC 9706 cells suggest gamma-synuclein may play role as negative regulator in of human ESCC.

gamma-synuclein may play a positive role in the progression of colorectal cancer

Gamma-synuclein protein is valuable for evaluation of progression of colorectal carcinoma; it is more sensitive to predict advanced stage and lymph node invasion when combined with either alpha- or beta-synuclein protein.

SNCG interacts only with the 18kDa region of Hsp70 substrate binding domain and the TPR motif of BubR1. Based on the interactions of SNCG with N-BubR1 and ANK peptide, the common residues of SNCG that mediate these interactions were identified.

members of the synuclein gene family, particularly SNCA and SNCG, affect the risk of developing diffuse lewy body disease.
Thermodynamic studies in conjunction with EPR confirm that alpha-synuclein, beta-synuclein, and gamma-synuclein bind copper(II) in a high affinity 1:1 stoichiometry.

Synuclein-alpha, -beta, and -gamma are important in regulating neurotransmitter release from specific populations of midbrain dopamine neurons through mechanisms that differ from those reported in other neurons.

gamma-synuclein is a promising new adjunct marker for identifying reactive follicular dendritic cells and for diagnosing follicular dendritic cell sarcoma and benign and malignant vascular tumors.

Study shows an overexpression of SNCG in bladder cancer (BC) tissues which correlates positively with neoplasm recurrence. SNCG seems a good marker to predict recurrence of BC, but not a reliable one for staging or prediction of survival rate.
Results demonstrated that urine SNCG can discriminate bladder cancer from urinary diseases, and is a useful prognosticator of postsurgical recurrence.
A positive SNCG may serve as a potential marker to identify breast cancer patients who are less likely to benefit from radiotherapy
High synoretin expression is associated with non-small cell lung cancer.
SNCG expression in ovarian cancer is frequent in patients with high-risk features, but it does not correlate with chemotherapy response, overall survival, or progression-free survival.

This largest collection of USCs to date demonstrates that SNCG was associated with poor survival in univariate analyses. SNCG does not predict survival outcome independent of p53 and p16 in models that jointly consider multiple markers.

multi-slice spiral CT (MSCT) can accurately evaluate the effect of chemotherapy in breast cancer. The results of MSCT were closely related to the expression of BCSG1, which may provide a reference for predicting the effect of chemotherapy in breast cancer which could have important clinical significance.

name: synuclein gamma
summary: This gene encodes a member of the synuclein family of proteins which are believed to be involved in the pathogenesis of neurodegenerative diseases. Mutations in this gene have also been associated with breast tumor development. [provided by RefSeq, Jan 2010].
